articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 6th in F# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in F# (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played or sung in sequence, one after the other, rather than all at once. The Minor 6th arpeggio in the key of F# with the shape of C consists of the notes F#, A, C#, and D#.

## Notes and Intervals:
- F# (Root)
- A (Minor 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- D# (Minor 6th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
Arpeggios are commonly used in various genres such as classical, jazz, rock, and metal music. The Minor 6th arpeggio in F# with the shape of C has a melancholic and introspective sound due to the minor intervals it contains. It can evoke feelings of longing or contemplation when used in music.

## Songs:
1. **"Hotel California" by Eagles:** The iconic guitar solo in this song features arpeggios, including the Minor 6th arpeggio in F#.
   
2. **"Nothing Else Matters" by Metallica:** This classic ballad by Metallica incorporates arpeggios, showcasing the emotional depth of the Minor 6th arpeggio in F#.

3. **"Cliffs of Dover" by Eric Johnson:** This instrumental guitar piece is known for its intricate arpeggios and technical prowess, including variations of the Minor 6th arpeggio in F#.
